pr_title: [automation] Corrected issue where scripts were not starting when OH restarted

timeline.message:
Corrected issue where scripts were not starting when OH restarted

Fixes #841. I also added a few file extensions to the list that are not loaded as scripts.I've tested on Windows 10 and Fedora 31.

Signed-off-by: Scott Rushworth <openhab@5iver.com>

timeline.bodyText:
Instead of blacklisting wouldn't it be safer to define a whitelist of allowed file extensions?
Otherwise you should put string litterals first in comparisons or may introduce a Set of Strings and check if the set contains your blacklisted extension.
timeline.author: cweitkamp

replies.bodyText:
It would be very difficult to use a whitelist, since any compatible ScriptEngineFactory could be used and there's no way to tell what file extensions might be used.
I'll remove this for now and add a separate PR with a better way to blacklist. I really shouldn't have included this here anyhow, but I've wanted to exclude these extensions for a while.
replies.author: 5iver

replies.bodyText: I have reverted this change and will submit another PR for it. Please squash the commits (I'm using the Github UI for this PR).
replies.author: 5iver
